title: Workshop on Digital Content Development Based on Information Processing Theory

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational educational technology theory and experience with digital media applications
context.additional_context: Strengthening competency in developing customized science education technologies for managers/leaders within corporate settings

learning_goals: Digital content design principles based on information processing theory can be applied with 80% or higher accuracy
Prototype evaluations (expert validation, 1:1 testing, small group testing) can be conducted according to the stages of the Hannafin & Peck model
Interactive digital content aligned with science education objectives can be developed using a PBL (Project-Based Learning) approach

resources: Digital Content Development Tools (Adobe Captivate, Articulate 360)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
